publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8122 Dr Richard Simpson: Tayside Wild Beavers—That the Parliament notes that the group of beavers that have established themselves in Tayside and Angus may be the subject of proposals for capture and extermination and calls on the Scottish Government to make it clear that this action will not happen and that consideration should be given to incorporating them into an extended study of beavers to determine the effect on the environment.

S3M-8122 Dr Richard Simpson: Tayside Wild Beavers—That the Parliament notes that the group of beavers that have established themselves in Tayside and Angus may be the subject of proposals for capture and extermination and calls on the Scottish Government to make it clear that this action will not happen and that consideration should be given to incorporating them into an extended study of beavers to determine the effect on the environment.
S3M-8122 Tayside Wild Beavers (lodged on 9 March 2011) Elaine Smith*, Mike Pringle*
S3M-8122 Tayside Wild Beavers (lodged on 9 March 2011) Liam McArthur*, Ross Finnie*, Robin Harper*
S3M-8122 Tayside Wild Beavers (lodged on 9 March 2011) Margo MacDonald*
S3M-8122 Tayside Wild Beavers (lodged on 9 March 2011) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-8122 Tayside Wild Beavers (lodged on 9 March 2011) Alison McInnes*

S3M-8122 Dr Richard Simpson: Tayside Wild Beavers—That the Parliament notes that the group of beavers that have established themselves in Tayside and Angus may be the subject of proposals for capture and extermination and calls on the Scottish Government to make it clear that this action will not happen and that consideration should be given to incorporating them into an extended study of beavers to determine the effect on the environment. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Mike Pringle, Liam McArthur, Ross Finnie, Robin Harper, Margo MacDonald, Marilyn Livingstone, Alison McInnes, John Park*
